snippet: President Obama is known to play a game of basketball for luck on days he faces an electoral contest. Tuesday was no different.
abstract: Pres Obama plays game of basketball with friends and aides on Election Day, fulfilling a superstitious ritual that he has maintained since before the 2008 election; aides maintain sense of quiet optimism throughout day and into evening, as increasingly good results pour in; Obama's victory speech is also marked by optimism, and determination to move forward with change.
lead_paragraph: President Obama is known to play a game of basketball for luck on days he faces an electoral contest. Tuesday was no different.

headline.main: A Bit of Quiet Optimism, and Some Superstition, Before a Tight Victory
headline.print_headline: Bit of Quiet Optimism, And Some Superstition, Before Victory at the Polls
